pageTitle: Synopsis - Oracle Solaris Cluster Reference Manual
textBeforeTable: See attributes(5) for descriptions of the following attributes: Attributes # clquorum list -v pcow2 # clquorum list The following clquorum commands display the quorum devices in concise format and verbose format. Example 7 Displaying the Configured Quorum Devices in the Cluster # clquorum enable d4 The following clquorum command resets the configured quorum vote count of a quorum device, d4, to the default. Example 6 Resetting the Quorum Votes of a Quorum Device qs1 1 1 Offlineclquorum status qs1 # clquorum disable qs1 The following clquorum command puts a quorum device, qs1 into a maintenance state and verifies that the device is in a maintenance state. Example 5 Putting a Quorum Device into a Maintenance State The command that you use to remove a quorum device is the same, whether your device has a type of shared_disk, netapp_nas, or quorum_server.  # clquorum remove d4 The following clquorum command removes the d4 quorum device. Example 4 Removing a Quorum Device # clquorum add -t quorum_server -p qshost=10.11.114.81 -p port=9000 qs1 The following clquorum command configures a quorum server, qs1: Example 3 Adding a Quorum Server The name of the NetApp NAS quorum device must be unique across all cluster quorum devices. # clquorum -t netapp_nas -p filer=nas1.sun.com pcow2 node pcow1 node qd1 netapp_nas d4 shared_disk ------- ---- Quorums Type pcow1 qd1 d4 ----------- ------- -------- ------ Device Name Present Possible Status --- Quorum Votes by Device --- === Cluster Quorum ===   #
